moves.4... dxc4 5. e4 Bb4 6. Bg5 h6 7. Bxf6 Qx: Development is nearly complete for both sides, although Black's Q-side is lagging a bit.
moves.8... O-O 9. O-O: With both Kings tucked away, now the tactics can start.
moves.9... Bxc3 10. bxc3: An exchange that helps me, opening the QN file for my Rook.
moves.12... f5 13. Ne5: With the Black KB pawn no longer able to contest the square, I seize the outpost for my Knight.
moves.13... Qe8 14. Rfe1: An exchange of Pawns would now open the file for my Rook.
moves.14... Nd7 15. Nxd7: Rather than retreat, I simply capture.
moves.19... Rd8 20. h3: To guard against any last-ditch tries by Black of a back-rank mate.
moves.20... Kf8 21. Bf5: If 21... BxB, 22 RxQ CHECK forces Black's hand. 22... RxR or 22... KxR is followed by 23 QxB with a winning advantage of a Q for a R and a Pawn ahead to boot.
moves.21... Rd6 22. Bxe6: If 24... QxB, 25 RxQ secures a winning material edge. So Black tries 24 RxB...
moves.22... Rxe6 23. Qf5+: ...only to be blindsided by this move, winning the Rook.
